title: BACnetWritePropertyMultiple (Function)
text:
FUNCTION BACnetWritePropertyMultiple :
IEC_BACNET_STATUS
Sends an WritePropertyMultiple request.
Modifies the values of one or more specified properties of one or more Objects.
This routine may control APDU properties like APDU length, segmentation, and timeout
for both request and in response. This routine can execute asynchronously, i.e. this
routine will return to the caller before the BACnet reply comes so that the
application can keep running. In this case the response information will be received
by the thread which is responsible for receiving asynchronous responses. An optional
BACNET_WRITE_PROP_MUL_COMPLETE_CB routine, which is provided by the application,
shall be used to process this information. If a number of asynchronous requests are
sent, the responses shall be queued and identified by the transaction handles.
If the application does not supply the BACNET_WRITE_PROP_MUL_COMPLETE_CB routine
then this routine sends a request and waits for the reply.
Asynchron call. As soon as pResultStatus is
IEC_BACNET_STATUS.BACNET_STATUS_OK
the call was successfully completed.

rows.Name: BACnetWritePropertyMultiple
rows.Comment: A status indicating whether the operation worked.

rows.Name: pSourceAddress
rows.Comment:
If the BACnet application has only one device constructed and installed, this can
be 0. In this case the MAC address of this device will be used. Otherwise this
shall be the MAC address returned on device object construction.

rows:
This is the MAC address of the device to which the request
should be sent.
A pointer to the service request information data structure.

A pointer to the APDU-Properties structure which sets APDU properties for this
transaction only. This does not change global defaults or settings for the application
APDU Properties. This argument may be 0. In this case APDU properties  are used
which were specified in the device object properties of the applications device which
sends the request.
Transaction token of the asynchronous call - seeBACnetAsyncTransactionToken.

A pointer to a structure to hold BACnet Error information. pError may be 0 if the
application isnât interested in detailed error information.

A pointer to a structure to hold the device object property refernce which failed
to be written.
